ygData.subject: negative_A reaction option returning nan
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I have successfully installed Cantera onto my Linux box and am trying to replace numerous Chemkin subroutines in a code of mine with corresponding Cantera

Hi,

I have successfully installed Cantera onto my Linux box and am trying
=
to replace numerous Chemkin subroutines in a code of mine with
correspondin=
g Cantera calls.  I have translated a mechanism from the
Chemkin format int=
o Cantera format by using the ck2cti program with
the verification option a=
nd seemed to pass.  I'm calling
getNetProductionRates(wdot) from my program=
 and am getting "nan" in
return for seven different species.  I have tracke=
d the problem by
calling:

getFwdRatesOfProgress
getRevRatesOfProgress
getF=
wdRateConstants
getRevRateConstants

and have found that there are two reac=
tions in my mechanism that are
returning a "nan" value.  They are both reac=
tions that have been
declared as duplicate reactions and they also both hav=
e negative
pre-exponentials.  (These are the only reactions in my mechanism=
 that
have a negative pre-exponential.)  My original Chemkin mechanism file=

had the following within it:

First Reaction:
NH+NO=3DN2O+H               =
2.94E+14  -0.40   0.000E+00
DUP
NH+NO=3DN2O+H              -2.16E+13  -0.23=
   0.000E+00
DUP

Second Reaction:
NH2+NO=3DN2+H2O             1.30E+16  -1=
.25   0.000E+00
DUP
NH2+NO=3DN2+H2O            -2.80E+13  -0.55   0.000E+00=

DUP

The listed reactions in the cti conversion of this mechanism file loo=
k
like this:

First Reaction:
#  Reaction 77
#  10.5, 9 (a)
#  Miller & Mel=
ius, 24th Symp. on Comb., 1992.
reaction(  "NH + NO <=3D> N2O + H",  [2.940=
00E+14, -0.4, 0],
         options =3D ["duplicate"])

#  Reaction 78
react=
ion(  "NH + NO <=3D> N2O + H",  [-2.16000E+13, -0.23, 0],
         options =
=3D ["negative_A", "duplicate"])

Second Reaction:
#  Reaction 90
#  10.6, =
9 (b)
#  Glarborg et al., Int. J. Chem. Kinet., 26, 421, 1994.
reaction(  "=
NH2 + NO <=3D> N2 + H2O",  [1.30000E+16, -1.25, 0],
         options =3D ["=
duplicate"])

#  Reaction 91
reaction(  "NH2 + NO <=3D> N2 + H2O",  [-2.800=
00E+13, -0.55, 0],
         options =3D ["negative_A", "duplicate"])

And t=
he xml translation contains the following:

First Reaction:
    <!-- reacti=
on 0077    -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" id=3D"007=
7">
      <equation>NH + NO [=3D] N2O + H</equation>
      <rateCoeff>
    =
    <Arrhenius>
           <A>2.940000E+11</A>
           <b>-0.40000000000=
000002</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
        </Arrhenius=
>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NH:1.0 NO:1</reactants>
      <produc=
ts>H:1 N2O:1.0</products>
    </reaction>

    <!-- reaction 0078    -->
  =
  <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" negative_A=3D"yes" id=3D"0=
078">
      <equation>NH + NO [=3D] N2O + H</equation>
      <rateCoeff>
  =
      <Arrhenius>
           <A>-2.160000E+10</A>
           <b>-0.23000000=
000000001</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
        </Arrhen=
ius>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NH:1.0 NO:1</reactants>
      <pro=
ducts>H:1 N2O:1.0</products>
    </reaction>


Second Reaction:
    <!-- re=
action 0090    -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" id=3D=
"0090">
      <equation>NH2 + NO [=3D] N2 + H2O</equation>
      <rateCoeff=
>
        <Arrhenius>
           <A>1.300000E+13</A>
           <b>-1.25</b=
>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
        </Arrhenius>
      <=
/rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NO:1 NH2:1.0</reactants>
      <products>N2:1.=
0 H2O:1</products>
    </reaction>

    <!-- reaction 0091    -->
    <reac=
tion duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" negative_A=3D"yes" id=3D"0091">
 =
     <equation>NH2 + NO [=3D] N2 + H2O</equation>
      <rateCoeff>
       =
 <Arrhenius>
           <A>-2.800000E+10</A>
           <b>-0.5500000000000=
0004</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
        </Arrhenius>
=
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NO:1 NH2:1.0</reactants>
      <product=
s>N2:1.0 H2O:1</products>
    </reaction>

As far as I can tell everything =
has been converted correctly.  From
what I have found by looking around the=
 available Cantera literature,
the only way that a negative pre-exponential=
 factor can be used inside
Cantera is for it to be declared as part of a du=
plicate reaction, be
declared as having the option negative_A, and have the=
 total overall
rate be positive.  Something is happening here though, as th=
e even the
rate coefficients are being returned as "nan" values.  This is
c=
onsistent with both the forward and reverse coefficients, and
obviously the=
 forward and reverse rates of progress.  Am I
understanding all this correc=
tly?

As far as I can tell, I'm within the parameters set by Cantera to use=

negative pre-exponential factors, but I'm getting these bogus values
in re=
turn, and am not sure (what to do)/(what to check) next.  Do you
know what =
might be wrong?  Is there something else that I can check to
make sure that=
 I'm doing things right?  Thanks.

Dan Smyth
